channel.title: 317 vs. 508+?
channel.description: Hey guys, I was wondering if there is any difference in coding the original 317's vs. any thing higher.. like is it harder to code?

stooks:

It’s a bunch of files that make your rsps more like real rs… at least that’s how I saw it

item.title: 317 vs. 508+?
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:11, topic:414147”][quote author=F A I L S link=topic=516107.msg3744830#msg3744830 date=1315668953]
Your welcome, and honestly, You will not get good at coding a 508 if you stick with PI, Your probably thinking, “If I get good at coding PI i can also code a 508”, Correct me if i’m wrong, but that’s not the case. If you want to move on, Move on, and familiarize yourself with a 508.
[/quote]
I figured that would be the case, seeing as every base has different coding, but I like the 317’s, and like Mendorphins said, if I want better graphics, I could just go play rs, and to top it all off, ive seen 508+'s have alot of problems.[/quote]
That’s because there’s been more time to develop 317s than 508s.

Read full topic

I figured that would be the case, seeing as every base has different coding, but I like the 317’s, and like Mendorphins said, if I want better graphics, I could just go play rs, and to top it all off, ive seen 508+'s have alot of problems.

item.title: 317 vs. 508+?
item.dc:creator: @F_A_I_L_S Fails
item.description:
@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

Well, you say 508’s are different because your use to 317, Right? Well no matter what he starts off with, I’m sure he will do great, all you have to do is find some research on 508 servers, familiarize yourself with the codes/files, and then look up some tutorials, and you will be on your way. If you choose a 508 or a 317, Whichever you choose, before you post a “server Help” Topic, please research the problem before you post it on here.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 vs. 508+?
item.dc:creator: @stooks stooks
item.description:
@stooks wrote:

F A I L S:

317’s are mighty easy to code, 508+ is a bit different, For example 508’s do not have the same files as 317’s. So if you start a 317, then move to 508+ It will take getting used to, get familiarized with the source your using, etc.

Yeh, I switched from 317 to 508 with Austin Cadle’s sources, just trying em out and stuff, but I decided to stay with 317’s, even with the same coder, the files were all scrambled around not the way I was used to, the coding was a bit different, actually a little bit more than a bit :P, so for starters, 317’s is the way to go :). If you feel like coding a high-graphics and feel up to the challenge, go for a 508+ though.

Read full topic
